DataElement.preferredName: Person Gastrointestinal Absorption Inhibition Exclusion Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a person has a gastrointestinal absorption inhibition, involves interference with, or restraint of, activities of uptake from the intestinal lumen of fluids, solutes, proteins, fats, and other nutrients into the intestinal epithelial cells, blood, lymph, or interstitial fluids, as the medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Gastrointestinal Absorption Inhibition Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a gastrointestinal absorption inhibition, involves interference with, or restraint of, activities of uptake from the intestinal lumen of fluids, solutes, proteins, fats, and other nutrients into the intestinal epithelial cells, blood, lymph, or interstitial fluids, as the medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

Property.preferredDefinition: Gastrointestinal Absorption Inhibition involves interference with, or restraint of, activities of uptake from the intestinal lumen of fluids, solutes, proteins, fats, and other nutrients into the intestinal epithelial cells, blood, lymph, or interstitial fluids.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: Gastrointestinal Absorption Inhibition involves interference with, or restraint of, activities of uptake from the intestinal lumen of fluids, solutes, proteins, fats, and other nutrients into the intestinal epithelial cells, blood, lymph, or interstitial fluids.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have impairment of gastrointestinal (GI) function or GI disease that may significantly alter the absorption of buparlisib (e.g., ulcerative diseases, uncontrolled nausea, vomiting, unresolved diarrhea, malabsorption syndrome, or small bowel resection)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient not have any cli
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient not have any clinically significant gastrointestinal abnormalities that may alter absorption such as malabsorption syndrome or major resection of the stomach or bowels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have malabsorption syndrome or other condition that would interfere with intestinal absorption?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient does not have any clinically significant gastrointestinal abnormalities that may alter absorption such as malabsorption syndrome or major resection of the stomach or bowels?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have grade 2 or greater diarrhea?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any clinically significant gastrointestinal abnormality as noted in the protocol that may alter absorption?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any GI disorder, which in the opinion of the treating investigator, may affect absorption of oral medications, such as malabsorption syndrome or major bowel or stomach resection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient present with manifestations of malabsorption due to prior gastrointestinal (GI) surgery, GI disease or for an unknown reason that may alter the absorption of MLN0128 (sapanisertib) or have an enteric stomata?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any GI disorder, which in the opinion of the treating investigator, may affect absorption of ZEN003694 and other oral medications, such as malabsorption syndrome or major bowel or stomach resection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of malabsorption syndrome or other condition that would interfere with enteral absorption or results in the inability or unwillingness to swallow pills?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any condition (e.g., gastrointestinal tract disease resulting in an inability to take oral medication or a requirement for IV alimentation, prior surgical procedures affecting absorption, or active peptic ulcer disease) that impairs their ability to swallow and retain dasatinib and icosapent ethyl tablets?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an impairment of gastrointestinal function that may significantly alter the absorption of ZEN003694 (ZEN-3694) or talazoparib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active inflammatory gastrointestinal disease, chronic diarrhea (other than exocrine insufficiency controlled by enzyme replacement therapy), short gut syndrome, or other conditions that would limit the absorption of the study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any gastrointestinal condition which could impair absorption of CA-4948 or inability to ingest CA-4948?
